business.headline: Apple loses UK lawsuit over App Store's unfair 30% developer commissionsApple has been found guilty in a London court for abusing its dominant position by charging app developers an unfair 30 per cent commission on its App Store. The ruling marks a significant legal challenge against the tech giant's business practices in the UK market.

Dreamliner aircraft saw 31 faulty deployment of emergency turbine in 14 yearsBoeing's Dreamliner aircraft reported 31 instances of faulty deployment of Ram Air Turbine, which is deployed automatically in the eventuality of a dual engine failure or total electric or hydraulic failure.

Wasting your credit card reward points? Here's how to track and redeem smartlyMost people use their credit cards daily but forget one key benefit — reward points. These points can fetch you free flights, hotel stays, or cashback, but only if tracked and redeemed wisely. Here's how to make every swipe count.
Sensex ends 130 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 130.06 points to end at 84,556.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 22.80 points to close at 25,891.40.

HUL shares rise nearly 3% after Q2 results and dividend announcementHUL shares have been on a steady uptrend in recent months. Over the last six months, the stock has gained 8.03%, while it has risen 3.81% in the past month and 1.84% in the last five trading sessions.

Is your savings account on tax radar? 7 bank transactions that raise red flagsYour savings account might not be as private as you think. Certain transactions can draw the tax department's attention and trigger scrutiny.

Oil prices surge 3% as India rethinks Russian crude purchases: ReportIndia, which has been the largest buyer of discounted Russian oil since 2022, imported around 1.7 million barrels per day in the first nine months of this year. However, the latest sanctions could now force Indian companies to shift to other suppliers.

Gold and Silver prices today: Check rates, future outlook, key support levelsGold and silver prices fell after record highs as investors booked profits. Easing geopolitical risks, a stronger dollar, and US–India trade optimism weigh, though long-term trends remain bullish.

Bitcoin stuck around $108K. Is the crypto rally fading?Bitcoin, the world's largest and most popular cryptocurrency, has slipped by nearly 1.94% over the past week and was trading around $108,922 at the time of writing. Ethereum, its closest rival, also fell by 3.57% in the same period.
Did Trump get this one right? Report claims India to slash Russian oil buysThe country's top private buyer of Russian oil, plans to significantly cut or completely halt its crude imports from Moscow.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?Infosys, HCLTech, and TCS stocks rallied today on the BSE and NSE, driven by India–US trade optimism, Infosys' record buyback, strong Q2 earnings expectations, and renewed investor confidence.

ITR refund still pending? Check your status online and know the reasons for delayWhile many taxpayers have already received their refunds, a few are still waiting for the amount to reach their bank accounts. If you haven't received yours yet, here's how you can track your refund online and find out what might be causing the delay.

Sensex, Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs: Will festive rally continue on Dalal Street?Sensex and Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs, fueled by festive optimism, trade deal hopes, and strong domestic and FII inflows. Key sectors like IT, pharma, and textiles are leading gains.

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

Infosys shares rise over 4% today: What's driving the rally?Infosys shares jumped 3.2% to Rs 1,519.75 after announcing a record Rs 18,000 crore buyback. Promoters abstaining boosted investor sentiment, driving IT stock gains and strong market interest today.

Markets heading towards all-time high: Where should you invest now?After weeks of steady growth, benchmark indices are now showing signs of reaching fresh all-time highs, with investors looking for the next big opportunity.

Sensex jumps 800 points: Why is the stock market rising today?Markets rally as Sensex and Nifty climb on trade deal optimism. IT, pharma, textiles lead gains. Will the festive momentum sustain or face volatility? Traders remain watchful.

Sensex, Nifty rise further as reports hint at positive India–US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 571.48 points to 84,997.82 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading above 26,000. Broader market sentiment also remained upbeat, supported by steady global cues and sustained domestic optimism.

Will Sensex, Nifty touch record highs today amid festive momentum?India's retail industry recorded its biggest-ever festive season sales this year, with Diwali business touching Rs 5.40 lakh crore in goods and Rs 65,000 crore in services.
Will gold and silver prices fall more today after the recent crash?Gold had fallen the most in over a decade on Tuesday, while silver recorded its steepest one-day decline since February 2021.

entertainment.headline: Amar Kaushik on Vicky Kaushal's Mahavatar inspired by childhood in Arunchal Pradesh Director Amar Kaushik revealed that Vicky Kaushal's 'Mahavatar' is his most personal and spiritually inspired film. The project draws from his childhood experiences and aims to blend deep spirituality with advanced VFX challenges.

Spirit: Sandeep Vanga teases Animal themed audio story on Prabhas' birthday Sandeep Reddy Vanga shared an audio-story of his under-production film 'Spirit' on Prabhas' 46th birthday. He shared the audio teaser in five Indian languages.

IT Welcome to Derry first reviews: Pennywise origin story called prestige horror The 'IT' prequel series 'Welcome to Derry' has received strong critical acclaim before its official release. While praised for its chilling origin story of Pennywise, some critics highlight issues with the narrative's overall impact.

Stranger Things Season 5 gets simultaneous theatrical and streaming release 'Stranger Things 5' finale will premiere simultaneously in theatres and on Netflix on December 31, 2025. This new release strategy marks a shift for Netflix and realises the Duffer brothers' long-held dream of a big-screen debut.

Exclusive: Arshad Warsi says Bollywood stopped taking risks, Saiyaara took a chance Arshad Warsi criticised Bollywood for avoiding risks. He highlighted the success of 'Saiyaara' as proof that taking chances can appeal to audiences.

Maarigallu trailer: A Kannada mystery thriller about a hunt for Kadamba treasure 'Maarigallu' is an upcoming Kannada web series starring Praveen Tej, Rangayana Raghu, and Gopalakrishna Deshpande, among others. An AI-generated rendition of Puneeth Rajkumar from the series had recently gone viral.

Soha-Saif to Ektaa-Tusshar: How Bollywood siblings celebrated Bhai Dooj Soha Ali Khan and Saif Ali Khan, as well as Ektaa Kapoor-Tusshar Kapoor, were among the Bollywood sibling duos that shared photos of their celebration on social media.

Mammootty's thriller Kalamkaval set to release in November, new poster out Mammootty's Malayalam action crime thriller 'Kalamkaval', co-starring Vinayakan and Meera Jasmine, is set for a worldwide theatrical release on  November 27, 2025.

South stars congratulate Ram Charan and Upasana as they announce second pregnancy Celebrity and fan wishes began pouring in after Upasana, wife of Ram Charan, posted a video on social media from the baby shower celebrations held during Diwali. The well-wishers included Manchu Manoj, Kajal Aggarwal, and others.

Hansal Mehta slams criticism he faced for supporting Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat Hansal Mehta responded to criticism for congratulating Milap Zaveri on his film's success. He emphasised films can enlighten and called out virtue signalling in debates around cinema.

Prabhas' Fauzi update: Chaithra J. Achar confirms joining Hanu Raghavapudi film Hanu Raghavapudi's pan-India drama 'Fauzi' gets even more exciting as Chaithra J Achar joins the cast, marking her Telugu debut alongside Prabhas.

Ba***ds composer Shashwat Sachdev collaborates with Oscar winner Hans Zimmer Music composer Shashwat Sachdev and Hans Zimmer joined hands to create the title theme track for the British series 'Virdee'. Sachdev described the experience as a blend of humility, pride, and soulfulness.
Chiranjeevi gets court protection over misuse of his name and image A Hyderabad court has barred the unauthorised use of Chiranjeevi's name, image, and film titles online.

Prabhas turns 46: Mahesh Babu, Rishab Shetty and others wish the pan-India star As pan-India superstar Prabhas celebrates his 46th birthday, the Telugu film industry poured in heartfelt wishes, celebrating the actor's humility, warmth, and enduring legacy.

Sarathkumar wants to act and shoot duet with Deepika after Dude success Actor R Sarathkumar playfully stated his desire to feature alongside Deepika Padukone. His humour-laced remarks and key role in 'Dude' has received a lot of attention among fans

Malaika Arora birthday: Kareena, Sonam, Kajol and others extend warm wishes Actors Kareena Kapoor, Sonam Kapoor and Kajol, among others, sent birthday wishes to Malaika Arora on Thursday. The actors posted throwback pictures and heartfelt notes for Malaika as she turned a year older.

Prithviraj Sukumaran returns to sets as 'i, Nobody' enters new production phase Prithviraj Sukumaran is back on the sets of 'i, Nobody' as the film begins a new schedule of shooting. A video of the actor's arrival in a Porsche 911 GT3 going viral.

Nikolaj Coster-Waldau spotlights Odisha's mangrove restoration in docuseries 'Game of Thrones' actor and UNDP Goodwill Ambassador Nikolaj Coster-Waldau spotlights Odisha's community-led mangrove restoration in the new season of his international documentary series. The series highlights local climate resilience efforts and global cooperation.

Kichcha Sudeep addresses Bigg Boss Kannada 12 halt, says the issue wasn't ours Bigg Boss Kannada faced an unexpected pause after environmental concerns shut down Jollywood Studios. Host Kichcha Sudeep later clarified on air that the issue had nothing to do with the show, thanking officials for their swift action in resuming production.

general news.headline: Delhi air quality stations check reveals faulty displays, hidden or dead monitorsDelhi has dozens of air monitoring stations meant to provide live updates on city's air quality for citizens. But India Today's on-ground verification found several either hidden, dysfunctional, or incorrectly placed.

Won't bow down under pressure: Putin slams US sanctions on Russian oil giantsThe US on Wednesday imposed sanctions against Russia's two largest oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, to curb Moscow's war funding and push for an end to the conflict in Ukraine.

Video: Indian trucker high on drugs goes on ramming spree in US, kills 3A dashcam video circulating on the internet shows 21-year-old Indian-origin driver Jashanpreet Singh crashing his semi-truck into at least nine vehicles on a California freeway, killing three people. Authorities said Singh, an illegal immigrant from India, was under drug influence and didn't apply brakes. ICE has issued a detainer against him.

Indian-American scholar Ashley Tellis granted pre-trial release in espionage caseIndian-American scholar Ashley Tellis has been granted pre-trial release in a major espionage case. The case highlights tensions in US counterintelligence and raises questions about government document handling.

Who is Mukesh Sahani, Bihar's VIP who worked with SRK in Devdas?Mukesh Sahani may lead a small party, but after being named Mahagathbandhan's deputy CM face, he seems to have emerged as the bloc's VIP. The influence of Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP) over Bihar's marginalised voters makes him a heavyweight in the alliance. Here's why naming Sahani the deputy CM face is smart politics.

Your grandpa came from India: Mehdi Hasan counters Nikki Haley's son on migrationNalin Haley, son of Republican leader Nikki Haley, has sparked controversy on social media after calling for an end to mass immigration. He also urged states to restrict H-1B visas. British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan countered, saying Haley's grandfather, Ajit Randhawa, had migrated from India to the US in 1969.

White House to fight legal challenges over H-1B visa rules, cites fraud in systemThe Trump administration will contest all lawsuits challenging the new H-1B visa fee policy. This move aims to safeguard American jobs but faces legal opposition from business groups.

Face us if you're a man: Pakistani Taliban commander dares Army chief Asim MunirThe footage, which emerged earlier this week, shows Commander Ahmad Kazim hurling direct taunts at Munir in language dripping with provocation and defiance.

Woman steals spotlight with impromptu Diwali dance at office, video wows 12 millionDressed in a striking blue saree, Shikha Sharma danced energetically to Ban Than Chali, turning the office into an instant dance floor.

Mandhana, Rawal masterclass powers India into semis, blows away New ZealandWomen's World Cup: Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal lit up Navi Mumbai with blistering centuries as India snapped their three-match losing streak and stormed into the semi-finals of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 with a commanding 53-run win over New Zealand.

Tejashwi Yadav's dare to NDA on Bihar CM face draws BJP's 'thugbandhan' jibeTejashwi Yadav was named the INDIA bloc's chief minister face on Thursday. In response, the BJP launched a blistering attack on the RJD leader, dismissing his promises as "empty rhetoric" and warning that Bihar would not return to the "dark era of Jungle Raj".

Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao, convicted of money launderingUS President Donald Trump has pardoned Binance founder Changpeng Zhao after his prison sentence for compliance violations. Since taking office, the Trump administration has dropped several enforcement actions against crypto firms.

Exclusive: Arshad Warsi says Bollywood stopped taking risks, Saiyaara took a chanceArshad Warsi criticised Bollywood for avoiding risks. He highlighted the success of 'Saiyaara' as proof that taking chances can appeal to audiences.

Rajasthan bureaucrat suspended after viral slap incident with petrol pump staffA video clip showing Chhotu Lal Sharma slapping petrol pump attendants in Rajasthan's Bhilwara went viral, sparking public outrage.

Yunus govt blinks, asks 2 student advisors to resign after BNP, Jamaat heatUnder mounting pressure from the BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami, the Muhammed Yunus-led interim government of Bangladesh has asked two student advisors, who were once hailed as heroes of the July-August uprising, to resign. The move reveals the balancing act of the Yunus administration on a proposed election and demands.

A 'fake' wife twist in Rajasthan SDM's petrol pump slap controversyThe incident at the petrol pump has put into the spotlight the controversial past of Rajasthan SDM Chhotu Lal Sharma, who has a history of suspensions, legal cases and domestic disputes.
Video: Toxic foam blankets Chennai's Marina Beach raising environmental concernsThe froth was observed where rainwater from city canals mixed with seawater near the Adyar estuary at Pattinambakkam.

Retirement soon? Virat Kohli's gloves gesture after Adelaide duck sparks speculationAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli raised his gloves to acknowledge the standing ovation from the Adelaide Oval crowd after being dismissed for a duck. While it appeared to be a poignant gesture following what could be his final international innings at one of his favourite hunting grounds, speculation over whether Kohli was hinting at retirement began swirling on social media on Thursday.

In major defence boost, Centre clears Rs 79,000-crore projects for Armed ForcesThe Defence Ministry said the decisions align with the government's Aatmanirbhar Bharat push for self-reliance in defence production.

Race of slaves: MAGA hate shocks India-born Trump backer Dinesh D'SouzaDinesh D'Souza, an ally of US President Donald Trump, faced racist abuse from a right-wing user who called Indians a 'disgusting race of slaves'. The Republican commentator condemned the hatred, questioning its legitimacy within conservative circles. The incident shows growing anti-Indian sentiment in MAGA ranks.

Soha-Saif to Ektaa-Tusshar: How Bollywood siblings celebrated Bhai DoojSoha Ali Khan and Saif Ali Khan, as well as Ektaa Kapoor-Tusshar Kapoor, were among the Bollywood sibling duos that shared photos of their celebration on social media.

Apple loses UK lawsuit over App Store's unfair 30% developer commissionsApple has been found guilty in a London court for abusing its dominant position by charging app developers an unfair 30 per cent commission on its App Store. The ruling marks a significant legal challenge against the tech giant's business practices in the UK market.

No $100,000 fee for F-1 to H-1B visa status change. Should Indian students relax?US clarification says the $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new petitions filed from abroad. F-1 students inside the US changing to H-1B are mostly exempt from the fee. But amid developments like capped study durations, OPT scrutiny, and reports of campus racism, Indian students face a shrinking window to study and work in the US.

Jai Shree Krishna: Bill Gates greets Tulsi Virani in new Kyunki promo. WatchMicrosoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates is confirmed to appear via video call in an upcoming episode of Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi. A new promo features a conversation between Gates and Smriti Irani's character, Tulsi.

sports.headline: Centurion Pratika Rawal explains her success mantra, gives update on Richa's injury Women's World Cup: After producing a near-perfect game with her all-round performance against New Zealand, India opener Pratika Rawal explained her success mantra while crediting the calm dressing room and support from her parents.

Bl**dy frustrating: Sophie Devine gutted after New Zealand exit Women's World Cup Sophie Devine lamented New Zealand's rain-hit Women's World Cup campaign, which ended with a 53-run DLS loss to India, despite strong individual performances from Brooke Halliday and Izzy Gaze.

Semi-final spot sealed, Harmanpreet Kaur hopes India can iron out bowling flaws Women's World Cup: Captain Harmanpreet Kaur breathed a sigh of relief as India clinched the fourth spot in the semi-finals with a dominant victory over New Zealand, while noting that the team still had to sharpen its bowling before the knockout rounds.

Smriti Mandhana surprised with POTM award vs NZ: Pratika deserved it as much as me Smriti Mandhana said she was surprised to see her win the Player Of The Match award, saying that Pratika Rawal also deserved it as much as her after beating New Zealand. The Indian opening pair setup India's win with their hundreds.

Mandhana, Rawal masterclass powers India into semis, blows away New Zealand Women's World Cup: Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal lit up Navi Mumbai with blistering centuries as India snapped their three-match losing streak and stormed into the semi-finals of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 with a commanding 53-run win over New Zealand.

Shreyas Iyer lifts the lid on his decision to take break from red-ball cricket Australia vs India: Shreyas Iyer broke his silence on taking a break from red-ball cricket following India's narrow two-wicket defeat to Australia in the second ODI.

Lionel Messi extends Inter Miami stay, signs new contract till 2028 Lionel has extended his stay with Inter Miami, signing a new contract with the club until 2028. Messi has led the club from the front since joining them in 2023 and is hoping to play at their new stadium.

Hope Agarkar, BCCI has informed Sarfaraz Khan why he was dropped: Sunil Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar hopes that Sarfaraz Khan got clarity from Chief selector Ajit Agarkar and the rest of the selection committee as to why he is out of the national team setup at the moment. Sarfaraz last played for India during the New Zealand home series in 2024.

Bangladesh spin their way to 2-1 series win over West Indies Bangladesh spun a web around West Indies, crushing them by 179 runs in the third ODI to claim their first series victory since March last year. A scintillating 176-run opening partnership between Saif Hassan and Soumya Sarkar laid the foundation for Bangladesh's 296 for 8, leaving the visitors reeling as they were bowled out for just 117 in 30.1 overs.

AUS vs IND: Shreyas Iyer admits series loss hurts but praises Australian batters India batter Shreyas Iyer admitted that the ODI series loss was painful but heaped praise on Australia's middle-order batters, who anchored their side to a narrow two-wicket victory in the second One-Day International at Adelaide Oval on Thursday. Iyer also noted that Australia's ability to make the most of bowler-friendly conditions helped them take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Virat Kohli hasn't given any signal, won't retire after 2 ducks: Sunil Gavaskar Batting great Sunil Gavaskar said people should not read too much into Virat Kohli's glove gesture in Adelaide, adding that the star batter is not the type to call it quits after just two back-to-back ducks in the ongoing three-match ODI series against Australia.

Lionel Messi extends Inter Miami stay, signs new contract till 2028 Lionel has extended his stay with Inter Miami, signing a new contract with the club until 2028. Messi has led the club from the front since joining them in 2023 and is hoping to play at their new stadium.

Sarfaraz last played for India during the New Zealand home series in 2024.

Iyer also noted that Australia's ability to make the most of bowler-friendly conditions helped them take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Rohit Sharma's patient, composed innings in Adelaide ODI pleases Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar praised Rohit Sharma for adapting to the situation and playing a patient, composed innings during the Adelaide ODI. After starting off slowly, Rohit scored 73 off 97 balls and was India's best player on the day.

How a technical tweak helped Shreyas Iyer prepare for Australia tourAfter a gritty 66 at Adelaide Oval, India batter Shreyas Iyer revealed that reverting to an upright batting stance has helped him regain both confidence and consistency.

Azhar Mahmood slams Pakistan's poor batting in Rawalpindi Test lossPAK vs SA, 2nd Test: Head coach Azhar Mahmood said Pakistan's recurring batting collapses cost them an eight-wicket defeat to South Africa at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium, leaving the series tied 1-1.

Sunil Gavaskar Exclusive: India Vs Australia | Two Cheap Dismissals For Virat KohliOn this special report, the focus is on Virat Kohli's form after he registered his first-ever back-to-back ducks in his ODI career during the series against Australia. Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar states, 'Come on, he's allowed a couple of failures. Don't read too much into what has happened.' The discussion also delves into Rohit Sharma's confident return to form with a crucial 70-plus score, his future in the ODI squad following his removal as captain, and the controversial non-selection of domestic run-machine Sarfaraz Khan, despite his consistent performances. Gavaskar provides his expert analysis on the challenges of batting on Australian pitches and the approach the senior players should take moving forward.

Message for Virat Kohli? R Ashwin's cryptic post sparks fan speculationR Ashwin has created buzz on social media with his tweet after India's loss to Australia in Adelaide on Thursday, October 23. Many fans speculate that the message from Ashwin was for Virat Kohli.

Tilak recalls battle with life-threatening muscle disease, thanks Akash AmbaniAsia Cup hero Tilak Varma recounted his battle with rhabdomyolysis, a potentially life-threatening condition caused by rapid muscle breakdown. The Hyderabad star said Mumbai Indians co-owner Akash Ambani and the BCCI provided timely support during his recovery.

PBKS appoint Sairaj Bahutule as new spin bowling coach before IPL 2026Punjab Kings have announced Sairaj Bahutule as their new spin bowling coach, replacing Sunil Joshi ahead of the next IPL season. The move aims to reinforce PBKS's bowling strategy and further develop young talent as the team prepares for the upcoming IPL auction and 2026 campaign.

While it appeared to be a poignant gesture following what could be his final international innings at one of his favourite hunting grounds, speculation over whether Kohli was hinting at retirement began swirling on social media on Thursday.

IND vs NZ: Pratika Rawal repays faith with maiden World Cup hundred, equals world recordPratika Rawal repaid the faith put in her by the Indian team management with a wonderful hundred against New Zealand in their Women's ODI World Cup clash in Navi Mumbai. Pratika also equalled a world record during her knock.

Rohit Sharma missed out on a big knock: Gill praises ex-captain's 73 vs AustraliaIndia captain Shubman Gill praised senior batter Rohit Sharma's gritty 73-run knock, adding that he felt the former captain missed out on a big score during India's loss to Australia in the second ODI of the three-match series at the Adelaide Oval.

Adam Gilchrist pens nostalgic Adelaide Oval post for Rohit SharmaAdam Gilchrist shared a heartfelt with Rohit Sharma during India's Adelaide ODI against Australia. The tribute recalls their first meeting at Adelaide Oval and years of collaboration in the IPL with Deccan Chargers.

IND vs NZ: Smriti Mandhana closes in on all-time record with blazing hundredSmriti Mandhana edged closer to Meg Lanning's all-time record for hundreds in women's ODIs with her 14th century during the India vs New Zealand clash. Mandhana got to the landmark in just 88 balls.

2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma's gritty 73 not enough as India lose series in AdelaideAustralia vs India, 2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma scored a gritty 73 while navigating challenging conditions, but it wasn't enough as Australia cruised to a comfortable victory in Adelaide. India suffered their first one-day defeat at Adelaide Oval in 17 years.

Women's World Cup: India drop Amanjot, bring in Jemimah for crucial New Zealand clashIndia women's cricket team have made a key change, bringing Jemimah Rodrigues back into the playing XI for their World Cup match against New Zealand. The decision aims to strengthen batting after recent struggles but has sparked debate among fans and experts.

Ravindra Jadeja likely for Saurashtra's Ranji Trophy clash vs Madhya Pradesh: ReportsRavindra Jadeja is set to return to first-class cricket with Saurashtra's Ranji Trophy clash against Madhya Pradesh. Reports suggest the all-rounder will play in Rajkot to regain red-ball rhythm ahead of India's Test season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
